metadata.synopsis: Unmarried yuppies Patty (Melanie Griffith) and Drake (Matthew Modine) move into an expensive dream home in a high-end neighborhood in San Francisco. As they renovate the house, they look for a tenant for the first floor of their house. Carter Hayes (Michael Keaton) seems like a great fit at first, but it transpires that he is a con artist who plans to swindle them out of their real estate. As Hayes tries to drive them out of their own home, the couple must take drastic measures to fight back.

reviews: Keaton is a particular highlight, playing a stark opposite to his previous turn as caped crusader Batman.
Paranoiac domestic thriller with confused ideas and hackneyed clichés, but some interesting moves and frissons.
Moderately entertaining suspense with an unusually foul villain at its core.
Michael Keaton as a malicious tenant. Aren't you scared just thinking about it?
A ludricrous retread of the same old Fatal Attraction formula
Corny, but worthwhile thriller, with a stellar, slightly unexpected turn, from Michael Keaton
Presents a telling portrait of white collar crime and the primal value of privacy in this information age.
